content.description:
Climbs the obvious jagged crack to friction face just left of the blunt arete. Also the downclimb as this is the easiest way up and down the boulder.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Right side of the south face and just right of

South Face Center

.

content.description:
Slab your way up the gritty face using the occasional black intrusion with the crux at the bottom.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Left side of the south face and just left of

South Face Center

.

content.description:
Climb the center of the face, up smears and tiny black knobs, just left of the descent crack.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.

Power over the chest-high bulge using some helpful black intrusions and minimal smears for your feet - wearing pants is a good idea on this problem.

* This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Far left side of the south face and just left of

South Face Left

.

content.description:
This climbs the obvious loose appearing flake on the East Side.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.

Face climb in between Embers and Firebug. Start right hand on a sharp but good undercling, left hand on a crimp. Get a right foot and stand up. Left hand goes to a textured crimp below the lip. A reach-y bump takes you up to a pretty solid rail. Match the rail, move right hand to a round mound/sloper. High left foot comes to the rail and rock over the edge to mantle.

Lieback and handrail your way up and across the arete to finish as for

Kindling

.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: The southeast arete of the boulder.

content.description:
Lieback up a flake, make some balancy moves to get stood up and then finish up the rounded, grainy face above.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the north face

content.description:
Balance up the arete on thin edges with tricky feet to gain the flake of

Kindling

.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location:
Just right of

Kindling

on the northeast arete of the boulder.
